Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with water and a plant without water, showing how each appears differently.
The student can depict how a plant looks healthy and growing when it has enough water.
The student can illustrate a plant appearing wilted or unhealthy when it does not have enough water.
The student can observe and include the natural environment around the plant, such as sunlight or shade, to show patterns related to plant growth.
The student can create a side-by-side comparison in their drawing to highlight the differences between a watered plant and a non-watered plant.
